title: Short Story Draft
goal: Plan and begin writing a short story.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Reading practice review:

Parse: mi djuno lo du'u do djica lo nu klama

(Answer: I know that you want to go — 3 levels)

New Material (5-7 min)

Story Planning

Before writing, plan:

Element Questions
Characters Who? Names?
Setting Where? When?
Plot What happens?

Story Structure

  1. Beginning — Introduce characters/setting
  2. Middle — Event/problem
  3. End — Resolution

Story Elements in Lojban

Element Tools
Characters la .NAME., descriptions
Setting Position words, spatial tenses
Time pu ki, .i ba bo
Dialogue lu...li'u, cusku
Feelings Attitudinals

Example Story Start

.i pu ki lo nicte cu co'a
.i la .alis. stali bu'u lo zdani
.i ri viska lo lunra poi carmi
.i ri cusku lu .ui lo lunra cu melbi li'u
.i ba bo ri klama bartu

Once upon a time (in the past), night began. Alice stayed at home. She saw the moon which was bright. She said "Yay, the moon is beautiful!" Then she went outside.

Key Point

Plan first, then write. Use all your tools: tense, dialogue, feelings, description.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise: Plan Your Story

Fill in:

Characters:

  • Name 1: ___
  • Name 2: ___

Setting:

  • Place: ___
  • Time: ___

Plot:

  • Beginning: ___
  • Event: ___
  • Ending: ___

Exercise: Write First Half

Write 50+ words (approximately 6-8 sentences):

Example Answer 
.i pu ki la .tam. xabju ne'a lo cmana
.i ro cerni ri cadzu bu'u lo foldi
.i lo djedi cu lenku je snime
.i la .tam. viska lo mlatu poi cmalu je blabi
.i ri cusku lu .ue do ma zvati li'u
.i lo mlatu cu spuda lu mi se claxu lo zdani li'u
.i la .tam. cusku lu ko kansa mi li'u

(Tom lived near a mountain. Every morning he walked in the field. The day was cold and snowy. Tom saw a cat which was small and white. He said "Wow, where are you?" The cat replied "I'm missing a home." Tom said "Come with me.")

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Read your story start aloud.

Check:

  • Does it flow?
  • Are tenses consistent?
  • Is it understandable?

Today's Plan

Story progress:

  • Characters planned
  • Setting planned
  • Plot outlined
  • First half written (50+ words)

Summary

You planned and started writing your short story. You'll complete it tomorrow.

Tomorrow preview: Short story completion.
